text:
A woman has been dating guy after guy, but it never seems to work out. She’s unaware that she’s actually been dating the same guy over and over; a shapeshifter who’s fallen for her, and is certain he’s going to get it right this time.

One day, a woman has a weird dream about her ex-husband.

A woman has been dating guy after guy, but it never seems to work out. She’s unaware that she’s actually been dating the same guy over and over; a shapeshifter who’s fallen for her, and is certain he’s going to get it right this time.

One day, a woman has a weird dream about her ex-husband. It was one of those dreams were you are in a place that you know, but it doesn't look anything like how it really looks. But you know it is that place anyway? And where you are with someone, but it doesn't look anything like them, but you still know it is them. It was a weird, short dream, and she woke up feeling like he was trying to tell her something. And that he looked familiar.

"Well, of course he looked familiar - even though he didn't look like Jake that's who I thought it was, so, wait, that doesn't entirely make sense, but whatever, " she thought "I really need more sleep, a vacation, and a new relationship, in any order."

Maggie had split up with her ex over a year ago now, and while she had been on a few dates since then nothing had really clicked.

It was a weird, short dream, and she woke up feeling like he was trying to tell her something. And that he looked familiar.

"Well, of course he looked familiar - even though he didn't look like Jake that's who I thought it was, so, wait, that doesn't entirely make sense, but whatever, " she thought "I really need more sleep, a vacation, and a new relationship, in any order."

Maggie had split up with her ex over a year ago now, and while she had been on a few dates since then nothing had really clicked. She felt like Jake was still lurking around, like he had never left.

"Well, of course he looked familiar - even though he didn't look like Jake that's who I thought it was, so, wait, that doesn't entirely make sense, but whatever, " she thought "I really need more sleep, a vacation, and a new relationship, in any order."

Maggie had split up with her ex over a year ago now, and while she had been on a few dates since then nothing had really clicked. She felt like Jake was still lurking around, like he had never left. Which didn't make any sense, as he hadn't contacted her once since the divorce was final. Which was itself weird, given how much he had fought the divorce and how hard he had tried to get her to give him a second chance.

Maggie had split up with her ex over a year ago now, and while she had been on a few dates since then nothing had really clicked. She felt like Jake was still lurking around, like he had never left. Which didn't make any sense, as he hadn't contacted her once since the divorce was final. Which was itself weird, given how much he had fought the divorce and how hard he had tried to get her to give him a second chance. 

But that was all in the past - Maggie had moved on and was looking forward to a new, better life.

One day, a woman has a weird dream about her ex-husband. It was one of those dreams were you are in a place that you know, but it doesn't look anything like how it really looks. But you know it is that place anyway? And where you are with someone, but it doesn't look anything like them, but you still know it is them. It was a weird, short dream, and she woke up feeling like he was trying to tell her something. And that he looked familiar.

"Well, of course he looked familiar - even though he didn't look like Jake that's who I thought it was, so, wait, that doesn't entirely make sense, but whatever, " she thought "I really need more sleep, a vacation, and a new relationship, in any order."

Maggie had split up with her ex over a year ago now, and while she had been on a few dates since then nothing had really clicked. She felt like Jake was still lurking around, like he had never left. Which didn't make any sense, as he hadn't contacted her once since the divorce was final. Which was itself weird, given how much he had fought the divorce and how hard he had tried to get her to give him a second chance. 

But that was all in the past - Maggie had moved on and was looking forward to a new, better life. Halfway through her drive to work, she realized who the guy in her dream had actually looked like - it was a grown up version of her high school boyfriend. "Well, that's still weird, but at least it makes a little sense. Matt and Jake were quite a bit alike in personality if not looks."

During her lunch break Maggie chatted with her best friend at work, Rachel. She told her all about the dream, and the two guys, and how weird it made her feel. "Sounds to me like your brain telling you to hurry up and find a new guy!

"Sounds to me like your brain telling you to hurry up and find a new guy! " Rachel had laughed, "I have a new guy friend I'm dying to introduce you to." As a matter of fact, how about we all get together after work for a drink?"

Maggie arrived at the bar a little early. And happened to start chatting with a guy. He seemed nice enough, but she didn't want to make anything awkward for Rachel and her friend so she firmly told the man that she was meeting someone. He pushed a little, but when he heard she was meeting a guy, suddenly backed off. As he walked away she noticed a pendant under his collar that caught her attention, though she couldn't remember why.

He pushed a little, but when he heard she was meeting a guy, suddenly backed off. As he walked away she noticed a pendant under his collar that caught her attention, though she couldn't remember why. 

Maggie sat there for a moment and tried to figure out why the odd necklace was so familiar, when she saw Rachel and the man enter. She started to wave, but then froze. The man was wearing a sweater, slightly rumpled. But under it was a shirt, that had the exact pattern as the one the man she had just been speaking to had been wearing.

Halfway through her drive to work, she realized who the guy in her dream had actually looked like - it was a grown up version of her high school boyfriend. Maggie arrived at the bar a little early. And happened to start chatting with a guy. He pushed a little, but when he heard she was meeting a guy, suddenly backed off. As he walked away she noticed a pendant under his collar that caught her attention, though she couldn't remember why. 

Maggie sat there for a moment and tried to figure out why the odd necklace was so familiar, when she saw Rachel and the man enter. She started to wave, but then froze. The man was wearing a sweater, slightly rumpled. But under it was a shirt, that had the exact pattern as the one the man she had just been speaking to had been wearing. And more importantly, Maggie could now clearly see that the pendant hanging from his neck was the same. And even more importantly she remembered why it was familiar. Her second boyfriend  had the same one - one he made in a metalworks class in college. 

And all of a suddenly so many connection began forming in her mind. All of the men she had ever dated, there were connection between all of them. She thought she had a type, but was it more than that?

The man, ran up to her, as Rachel looked confused. He gently escorted her out of the bar, and there, standing in an alley told her everything. And now she had a choice.

The man, ran up to her, as Rachel looked confused. He gently escorted her out of the bar, and there, standing in an alley told her everything. And now she had a choice. She could forget this ever happened and never see him again, or she could accept his offer.

"Well, of course he looked familiar - even though he didn't look like Jake that's who I thought it was, so, wait, that doesn't entirely make sense, but whatever, " she thought "I really need more sleep, a vacation, and a new relationship, in any order."

Maggie had split up with her ex over a year ago now, and while she had been on a few dates since then nothing had really clicked. She felt like Jake was still lurking around, like he had never left. Which didn't make any sense, as he hadn't contacted her once since the divorce was final. Which was itself weird, given how much he had fought the divorce and how hard he had tried to get her to give him a second chance. 

But that was all in the past - Maggie had moved on and was looking forward to a new, better life. Halfway through her drive to work, she realized who the guy in her dream had actually looked like - it was a grown up version of her high school boyfriend. "Well, that's still weird, but at least it makes a little sense. Matt and Jake were quite a bit alike in personality if not looks."

During her lunch break Maggie chatted with her best friend at work, Rachel. She told her all about the dream, and the two guys, and how weird it made her feel. "Sounds to me like your brain telling you to hurry up and find a new guy! " Rachel had laughed, "I have a new guy friend I'm dying to introduce you to." As a matter of fact, how about we all get together after work for a drink?"

Maggie arrived at the bar a little early. And happened to start chatting with a guy. He seemed nice enough, but she didn't want to make anything awkward for Rachel and her friend so she firmly told the man that she was meeting someone. He pushed a little, but when he heard she was meeting a guy, suddenly backed off. As he walked away she noticed a pendant under his collar that caught her attention, though she couldn't remember why. 

Maggie sat there for a moment and tried to figure out why the odd necklace was so familiar, when she saw Rachel and the man enter. She started to wave, but then froze. The man was wearing a sweater, slightly rumpled. But under it was a shirt, that had the exact pattern as the one the man she had just been speaking to had been wearing. And more importantly, Maggie could now clearly see that the pendant hanging from his neck was the same. And even more importantly she remembered why it was familiar. Her second boyfriend  had the same one - one he made in a metalworks class in college. 

And all of a suddenly so many connection began forming in her mind. All of the men she had ever dated, there were connection between all of them. She thought she had a type, but was it more than that?

The man, ran up to her, as Rachel looked confused. He gently escorted her out of the bar, and there, standing in an alley told her everything. And now she had a choice. She could forget this ever happened and never see him again, or she could accept his offer.

SHe asked a question "Which one was really you?" and he answered "They were all me, genuine me, just a little different looking. And you always came back to me. Remember - you approached me most of the time, or asked me out, or asked me to go home with you."

She stood still and decided, for once she would make a choice and stick with it. "Alright she said. Let's go back inside, and let Rachel introduce us. And then let's get back to our life, together."
